subject: Defective Brake Pedal - Ordered through Amazon
description_text:
Hello I ordered the Simsonn Pro X pedals on April 5th. The order number is
114-8560934-3717863. The product overall is great however, after using it
for 2 months my brake pedal stopped working. It's connects successfully
through the Simsonn manager app but it won't detect any pressure applied to
the pedal. I tried researching online for a potential fix but, it dosent
seem anyone other than me has this related issue. Is there something that
can get this fixed?

conversations.body_text: Hi Nick Cruz,     Could you please provide a photo of the SIMSONN Manager and a screenshot showing the SIMSONN device selected in the VBK tool? If the issue only affects the brake pedal, you can try swapping the brake and throttle pedal cables to see if the problem persists. This will help determine whether the issue lies with the pedal itself or the controller.

Hello, Im very sorry for the late response. I didn't know that I needed to create an account to view the ticket. I thought all conversation was directly by email. I attached a screenshot plus a short video of pressing all 3 pedals. The trottle and clutch pedals work but the brake is not getting feedback after putting pressure to it.

Hello, I'm very sorry for the late response. I didn't know that I needed to create an account to view the ticket. I thought all conversation was directly by email. I attached a screenshot plus a short video of pressing all 3 pedals. The trottle and clutch pedals work but the brake is not getting feedback after putting pressure to it.
I also forgot to mention after switching the brake and throttle pedal cables, the throttle pedal works however, the brake pedal doesn't detect any feedback.

Hi Nick Cruz,  Please remove the brake pedal from the mounting bracket, then use an M3 screwdriver to take off the protective cover at the bottom of the brake pedal. Reconnect all the plugs to ensure none of them are loose or damaged.

Hello, I apologize for not replying I was on a month long trip and I didn't have my rig with me. I circled the cables that I unplugged and made sure that there were well connected. Unfortunately it didn't work and no input was received

Hi Nick Cruz,  You can download SIMSONN Manager version 2.1.0 and update the pedal firmware. Then, use the Offset function in the interface to adjust the dead zone, which should solve the issue. If it still doesn’t work, you can install ToDesk and I can assist you remotely. If the problem remains unresolved, we will send you a replacement brake sensor.

Hello I installed the latest version of SIMSONN Manager and it still
doesn't work unfortunately. I have installed ToDesk onto my computer. When
can you connect to help me out remotely?

On Tue, Aug 5, 2025 at 9:17 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Nick Cruz,     Please uninstall the old version on your computer, then reinstall version 2.1.2 and update the firmware. After the update, the device version should display as CPU1: 2.0.5, CPU2: 2.0.3. If the issue is still not resolved, please feel free to contact me. If it still doesn’t work, please let me know your city and local time, so we can schedule a remote support session tomorrow.   https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PZwHUqhhmJw0IBGDO8mGONPbrICJU3z1/view?usp=drive_link

Where can I find version 2.1.2? I can only find 2.1.0.

On Sun, Oct 5, 2025, 12:02 PM service@simsonn.com

Apologies I didn't see the attached file on the email I'll test it out
tonight and let you know if it works

Hello, I tried using the new version and it still doesn't work. I attached
a video showing my brake inputs are not registering. I live in Plainfield,
NJ and my timezone is EST let me know when we schedule a support session.

On Sun, Oct 5, 2025 at 12:02 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Nick Cruz,  If you have adjusted the brake damping, you need to reset the pedal’s initial signal. Please click “Offset” in the software, set the initial pedal percentage to zero in the pop-up window, and then perform the calibration again.

Hello, I tried clicking offset in the software and It still can't detect
any brake inputs

On Thu, Oct 9, 2025 at 6:02 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi Nick Cruz, Please swap the throttle and brake connectors on the main controller to determine whether the issue is with the brake input port or the brake sensor itself. If it turns out to be a sensor issue, we’ll send you a new brake sensor free of charge for

I swamped my pedals and the brake input port worked with the throttle pedal
giving inputs but the brake pedal was not giving any inputs to the throttle
input.

On Thu, Oct 9, 2025 at 11:25 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi Nick Cruz,  If the brake signal only appears when you press very hard, please take a side photo of the brake so we can check. We’d like to confirm whether the upper limit screw above the sensor is improperly adjusted, which might be causing the issue. Also, please make sure that no bracket is blocking the bottom of the brake, as this could prevent the sensor from moving properly.

Here is a photo of the brake pedal

On Thu, Oct 16, 2025, 2:34 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi Nick Cruz,     You need to adjust the screw inside the center hole of the silver brake sensor located at the bottom of the pedal. While adjusting, observe the side limit screw — stop turning once it reaches the top position. If it’s not properly adjusted, the limit screw will prevent the pedal from moving down and the sensor won’t receive the correct pressure input.
